item.title: People's Republic of China
item.description: One Key Rope Skipper Name Xiaolin Cen Personal Profile Xiaolin Cen, male, was born in 2004 The first World Student rope skipping championship was held in Dubai, UAE in 2015.

item.title: MichAEl Chan
item.description: Nation: China Post: President Michael Chan began career of jump rope/rope skipping from 2012 as co-founder of China Rope Skipping Organisation (CRSA),authorized by The General Administration of Sport of P.

item.title: Janet Locke
item.description: Nation: Japan Post: Secretary General Janet’s involvement with jump rope began in fourth grade elementary school in the U.S. on a demonstration team, and began to really take off in 2003 after moving to Japan.

item.title: I.R. Iran
item.description: One Key Rope Skipper Name Kosar Askari Varaki Personal Profile I am a student of physical education at the university. I Started sports activities in the field of gymnastics from the age of 5 of 12 years old for 6 years .

item.title: INDIA
item.description: One Key Rope Skipper Name Saumya Agrawal Personal Profile She is Saumya Agrawal, an 18 years old jumper. She lives in Ujjain, a small city in Madhya Pradesh, India. She is currently studying in Kamala Nehru College, Delhi university and pursuing philosophy honours with psychology.

item.title: Sport Virtual Youth Festival 2020 Announcement
item.description: AJRU, after much deliberation, has decided to host an online Virtual World Championships in 2021. This will replace the in-person tournament originally scheduled for July 2021 in Ottawa, Canada. The Virtual World Championship Series will include the:

item.title: Diversity and Inclusion Webinar Recording
item.description: PRESIDENTIAL MESSAGE The meeting focused on the theme - ‚ÄúJumping Through Uncertain Times.‚Äù In the presidential message, AJRU President Shaun Hamilton, demonstrated a solid commitment to work with each NGB as the sport of jump rope/rope skipping continues to develop.

item.title: United Through Sport World Virtual Youth Festival Details and Registration
item.description: The United Through Sport World Virtual Youth Festival workshop series is just a few days away! Check out the schedule and stay tuned for more information about cheering on our jump rope/rope skipping athletes.

item.title: AJRU 2021 Virtual World Championships Announcement
item.description: The Asian Jump Rope Union (AJRU), after much deliberation, has decided to host an online Virtual World Championships in 2021. This will replace the in-person tournament originally scheduled for July 2021 in Ottawa, Canada.

item.title: Asian School Sports Federation
item.description: ISF signed the MoU with the Asian Jump Rope Union During the 2019 IF Forum, ISF signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the Asian Jump Rope Union (AJRU). The MoU was agreed between Mr Mike Simpson (AJRU Treasurer), in presence of Ms Rochelle Boggs (AJRU Co-Secretary General), and Mr Josip Kosutic, ISF Sports Director.

item.title: Arian Jump Rope Championship 2019 Highlights
item.description: Check out our special feature highlights of the 2019 Asian Jump Rope Championships. Produced by QTV Sports. Follow Asian Jump Rope on all social media platforms: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AJRUJumpRope/

item.title: Asian JUMP ROPE UNION BECOMES 10TH GAISF OBSERVER
item.description: The Asian Jump Rope Union (AJRU) has become the 10th Asian Federation to gain GAISF Observer status. The decision was taken by the Global Association of Asian Sports Federations (GAISF) Council, which meting during SportAccord in Bangkok.

item.title: TAFISA
item.description: TAFISA has over 320 members from more than 170 countries on all continents. Our member structure is unique and inclusive, comprising both governmental and non-governmental organizations, including: national and international sports federations, national Olympic committees, ministries of health, culture, education, sport, etc.
